summary: A 2006 Palm Beach Post news article reporting on the indictment of billionaire Jeffrey Epstein for felony solicitation of prostitution, based on accusations by teen girls. The article details his arrest, bond, the unusual nature of the felony charge, and provides background on his wealth and properties.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Indicted for felony solicitation of prostitution based on accusations by teen girls; booked at Palm Beach County jail and released on bond.

persons.name: Larry Keller
persons.context: Author of the Palm Beach Post article.

persons.name: Jack Goldberger
persons.context: Epstein's attorney who declined to discuss the charge.

persons.name: Mike Edmondson
persons.context: Spokesman for the state attorney's office who commented on the grand jury process for the prostitution-related charge.

persons.name: Gary Nikolits
persons.context: Sued by Epstein in 2001 over the assessment of his Palm Beach home.

persons.name: Alan Dershowitz
persons.context: Cited in a Vanity Fair profile as one of Epstein's friends and admirers.

connections.description: Goldberger is identified as Epstein's attorney in the criminal case.
Dershowitz is listed among Epstein's friends and admirers according to a Vanity Fair profile.
Epstein sued Nikolits in 2001 over property tax assessment.

events.title: Epstein Booked into Jail
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was booked at the Palm Beach County jail at 1:45 a.m. and later released on $3,000 bond.

events.title: Alleged Solicitation Period
events.description: The indictment alleges Epstein solicited or procured prostitutes three or more times during this period.

events.title: Indictment Reported
events.description: News article publishes details of Epstein's indictment for felony solicitation of prostitution.

events.title: Epstein Sues Property Appraiser
events.description: Epstein filed a lawsuit against Property Appraiser Gary Nikolits, contesting the assessment of his Palm Beach home.

events.title: Lawsuit Dismissed
events.description: Epstein dismissed his lawsuit against the property appraiser.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted for felony solicitation of prostitution, based on accusations by teen girls.
The indictment alleges the solicitation occurred three or more times between August 1 and October 31, 2005.
The case was unusual as suspected 'johns' are typically charged with a misdemeanor, not a felony via grand jury indictment.
Epstein was booked into Palm Beach County jail on July 23, 2006, and released on $3,000 bond.
The article references Epstein's vast wealth, including multiple large private homes, an island, and a fleet of aircraft.
